page.title: 04SOUTH CERNEY ARMY CAMP(CONT)
page.content: The famine in Northen Africa has seen many attempts this year to provide aid to remote areas of Ethiopia and the Sudan. The ability of the R.A.F. to drop eqipment from lowflying Hercules aircraft, has been used to supply food and medical aid to otherwise inaccesible areas. The work involved personel and equipment from the 29 Transport and Movements regiment at South Cerney, particulary in the preparation of the M.S.P.'s (Medium Stressed Pallettes) in which the equipment is packed to survive the parachute drop safely.
